ygData.subject: Re: Into the Teeth! (Tuscon)
ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson wasn t about to give into them.  It was clear as the snarl on his face and the narrow of his brow that he was not going to let anyone step all over him.

Tucson wasn't about to give into them.  It was clear as the snarl on his fa=
ce and the narrow of his brow that he was not going to let anyone step all =
over him.   He folds in his wings to protect them from harm and on all four=
s, manages to lunge forward toward the guards, with open jaws, hoping to ca=
tch and toss one of them into the other, creating a domino effect.
His stro=
ng tail acts like a rudder as it slaps hard against the wall.

Don't be env=
ious of what you don't have, be grateful for things you already posses.  No=
thing is worth more than family and friends.

On Nov 28, 2011, at 4:36 PM, =
Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson s=
hifts into his dragon form and swings around to face the guards.
> > " not =
the distraction I was going for but, this will do just the same. "
> >
> > =
Once in draconic form, he readies his tail as he attempts to trip the guard=
s
> > long enough to hopefully have one fall into the strong coils of his t=
ail in
> > a very strong constrictor grip, like a python squeezing it's pre=
y. He gives
> > the guards a deep throated hiss, bearing his teeth and fang=
s.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Unfortunately for TUSCON the guards do not trip over his=
 tail or fall
> into his coils. Not because TUSCON was not strong enough or=
 powerful
> enough but simply they were not close enough. They were still c=
oming
> down they hall when they saw his large bulky form. Instead of rushi=
ng
> in to do melee they simply stop and pull out their laser rifles and
> =
start firing, their laser blasts bouncing off the walls and targeting
> TUS=
CON, BIG CONVOY and the others.
> 
> At the same time alarms start blaring =
once again!
> 
> "I certainly hope this wasn't the distraction you were hop=
ing." MACH
> KICK said, his sarcasm covering his own growing tension.
> 
> =
BREAK nodded as he pulled back against the wall.
> 
> Over the radio LONG R=
ACK said, "I don't know what you guys are planing
> but security is moving =
in your direction."
> 
> BIG CONVOY nodded, "We're going to have to move be=
fore we are over run."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-8571A54E-2453-41E4-A64B-B6D1B8E90BAA

<html><head></head><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Tucson wasn't about to gi=
ve into them.  It was clear as the snarl on his face and the narrow of=
 his brow that he was not going to let anyone step all over him.   He =
folds in his wings to protect them from harm and on all fours, manages to l=
unge forward toward the guards, with open jaws, hoping to catch and toss on=
e of them into the other, creating a domino effect.</div><div>His strong ta=
il acts like a rudder as it slaps hard against the wall.</div><div><br>Don'=
t be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for things you already pos=
ses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.</div><div><br>On =

t;OLD><br>

> Tucson shifts into his dragon form and swings a=
round to face the guards.<br>
> " not the distraction I was going for bu=
t, this will do just the same.  "<br>
><br>
> Once in draconic form, =
he readies his tail as he attempts to trip the guards<br>

to hopefully have one fall into the strong coils of his tail in<br>

very strong constrictor grip, like a python squeezing it's prey.  He gives<=
br>

=

<NEW><br>
<br>
Unfortunately for TUSCON the guards do not trip o=
ver his tail or fall<br>
into his coils. Not because TUSCON was not strong =
enough or powerful<br>
enough but simply they were not close enough. They w=
ere still coming<br>
down they hall when they saw his large bulky form. Ins=
tead of rushing<br>
in to do melee they simply stop and pull out their lase=
r rifles and<br>
start firing, their laser blasts bouncing off the walls an=
d targeting<br>
TUSCON, BIG CONVOY and the others.<br>
<br>
At the same tim=
e alarms start blaring once again!<br>
<br>
"I certainly hope this wasn't t=
he distraction you were hoping." MACH<br>
KICK said, his sarcasm covering h=
is own growing tension.<br>
<br>
BREAK nodded as he pulled back against the=
 wall.<br>
<br>
Over the radio LONG RACK said, "I don't know what you guys =
are planing<br>
but security is moving in your direction."<br>
<br>
BIG CON=
VOY nodded, "We're going to have to move before we are over run."<br>
<br>

(TAG)<br>
